reviews.review_text: The restaurant is located in a quiet area and there is no dedicated parking, but one can park on the road. It is very popular with the locals. The place is very basic and one should avoid the closed portion as it is very noisy. The food is another story. We had chonak fry, liver masala, fried prawns, chicken masala, prawn pulao and nans. All well dishes were superb and the portions were good. Pricing is quite reasonable and the service was very quick. The bar service is just about ok and they had limited quantity of feni- this is an absolute no-no for a Goan restaurant. Do not go for the decor or atmosphere- the food makes up for the lack thereof. Definitely a place to try out some genuine seafood. The place is closed on Thursdays. For wheelchair guests, there are two steps for which the staff can assist.

I used to visit here 10 years back when I was residing in Goa. It was the best back than too. I recently visited it again and to my surprise, it was still as lovely!! The food is pure, authentic Goan style and pocket friendly. It's a great place to visit with family.

There was a time I was recommending people to visit kamlabai restaurant for fish , but now I won't ever

Today I visited at around 3.30 pm
Timing was unusual but still waiter were nice
Atmosphere was nice
I wanted kingfish thali,  but they didn't had it , so ordered modso thali & also ordered chicken 65 and a reshad bangdo
And fish taste wasn't even close to good
Modso#burso
Bangdo#burso
Chicken 65 was good
Rest things in thali were good , like tisro, Suki sungta kismoor that was tasty
But I won't ever recommend fish items in this resturant
One more thing I don't get is
For water bottles the MRP is 20 rs and still most of restaurants are charging 30 rs
